sources.title: One A.M. (1916)
sources.description: One A.M. is a unique Charlie Chaplin silent film created for Mutual Film in 1916. It was the first film he starred in alone, and also one of the very few films in which he did not play the Tramp character. Watch on RetroFlix.org:Â  https://retroflix.org/one-a-m-1916/

metadata.Plot: Drunk as a skunk, Charlie arrives home by taxi after a wild night out, only to realise that he has lost his key. Now, as an open window becomes the entrance, practically every single item or piece of furniture--including a possessed Murphy bed--becomes a formidable and insurmountable obstacle standing in his way, and working against him. Can't a man find peace at 1 o'clock in the morning?
metadata.Writer: Charles Chaplin, Vincent Bryan, Maverick Terrell
